Posts.Content: shells wrote: First of all, this experience has been very humbling.  My mother comes from a large not so close family.  She is the only female sibling of five.  While trying to investigate my family history regarding my breast lump...it turns out that my mother hasn't gone in for a mammo or pap for at least ten years by her account. (yes, I've said something) I'm guessing that means maybe twelve to fifteen years.  Her mother disappeared when she was seven.  My father was an only child. When my first mammo came back abnormal the nurse asked me if I had a history of breast disease in my family.  Of course I said no.  Now looking over the facts I don't know.  Since I have a lump should I be suspect that maybe I could have a family history?  How should I report my history. Thank you, shells Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: No Family History? shells leaf

Posts.Title: insurance denied coverage of MRI shells DebzNY

Posts.Content: shells wrote: I hope somebody can help me!  I'm 38 and had an abnormal mammo so I went back in for a follow up mammo which was also abnormal.  The also did an ultrasound which can back negative.  So the radiologist told me that day that we can wait six months or do an MRI.  I'm trying to have a baby so I can't wait.  My doctor ordered the MRI and then days before I was scheduled to go in for the MRI the medical director from BCBS called and said they wouldn't cover it because he as a doctor didn't find it necessary.  The procedure and the facility where I was scheduled are included in my benefits.  I was going to self pay but it costs $1500.  What to do? Thank you for any help.  I'm scared.  Also shocked that the insurance company can override my own doctor. shells Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: insurance denied coverage of MRI shells DebzNY

Posts.Content: Apr 7, 2008 02:18AM shells wrote: Oh my goodness, How blessed am I to have so many women to help me with my situation.  To answer a few concerns...the place where I've had my mammo's and u/s is a facility that does mostly breast mammos.  The radiologist at the facility took me in to his office with the lady that did the u/s to explain the results.
Posts.Title: insurance denied coverage of MRI shells DebzNY

Posts.Content: Apr 8, 2008 07:21PM shells wrote: Beesie, That's makes sense.  Thank you for clarifying.  My GYN has discussed having it removed and when I looked up the procedure I kept seeing the two terms.  Except with lumpectomies they said that most patients go on to be treated with radiology.  Which starting making me really nervous. Thank you! shells

Posts.Content: Apr 6, 2008 02:01AM shells wrote: G, Thank you.  My GYN did speak directly to the guy from BCBS.  Still said it wasn't necessary and they wouldn't pay.  The nurse gave me this guy's direct number and said I could call him on Monday.  So I'm trying to get some facts together to build up my case.  I'm so glad to have found this site.  I just read so many stories about women that had clear mammos, u/s and MRI and still had cancer.  The BCBS guy said that since my u/s was negative there was no need for an MRI.  I saw the lump on the mammo film from the radiologist and can feel the lump.  shells

The waiting is awful.  My nerves are shot. Shells

Posts.Content: shells wrote: Please let me know what to expect.  I'm 38 years old and had an abnormal mammogram regarding my right breast.  We jumped right to meeting with a breast surgeon because I'm trying to have a baby.  The breast surgeon found a lump on my left breast while doing a physical exam (nothing showed up on mammo).  I was in the middle of a miscarriage so I don't know if the hormones could have anything to do with that lump?  Tuesday I go in for a core needle biopsy - the lump on the right with the help of a strat mammo and the one on the left under the direction of an ultrasound.  Help please!  I need to know what to expect.  I'm so scared!!! Love, Shells Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Help! Core Needle Biopsy! shells leaf

Posts.Content: May 17, 2008 01:04AM shells wrote: Ladies, Hello and thank you so much for your support.  The day of my appointment they did an ultrasound on the left breast and decided not to do a biopsy on that breast because they didn't see anything on that u/s and the mammo was clear on that breast.  It was a lump my breast surgeon found during an exam.  Today at my follow up exam she said she wanted to see me again in three months to check on that lump because she still felt it and it was tender to the touch.  That's the time frame for my IVF.  Now I'm nervous again because it took two months from the time of my abnormal mammo to the time of the biopsy.  Do you think it would be okay to wait 12 months on that lump?  My right breast did get the core needle biopsy and the results were benign!!!  My husband and I are thrilled!  He lost his mother to breast cancer when she was only 32 years old.  Much Love, Shells
